image.altText: Green grass on a rolling hill at the national arboretum

props.synopsis: Tree pollen season is already triggering hay fever in the national capital, and the start of grass pollen season could be just weeks away, according to experts.

title.children: Arboretum photos indicate Canberra could have 'earlier and above average grass pollen season'

props.synopsis: ACT Supreme Court Justice Louise Taylor says Nathaniel Coulter, 22, was tasered despite the fact he was sitting in a car wearing a seat belt and in a submissive position after a dramatic car chase.

title.children: 'Used to punish': Judge criticises tasering by police in Canberra man's arrest

image.altText: Labradors are being trained to help PTSD sufferers

props.synopsis: Army veteran Chris Hodder was living with anxiety and PTSD, but says a pairing with service dog Bella has "changed my life for the better".

title.children: What happens to guide dogs who don't make it through training?

image.altText: The Alexander Maconochie Centre in the ACT.

props.synopsis: A coroner examining the suicide of a detainee at Canberra's jail has found the ACT had accommodated prisoners in cells they knew to be unsafe.

title.children: Luke was placed in a jail cell with a known suicide risk during COVID. He died the next day

image.altText: The scene of a car crash at night.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old charged with the death of a man in a collision earlier this year is set to face another charge, after a passenger injured in the crash died this week.

title.children: Teenager facing more charges after a second passenger dies from Barton Highway crash injuries

image.altText: Irma Palasics

props.synopsis: Undercover police followed a suspect on a camping trip from Melbourne to Cape York in the cold case investigation into the alleged murder of Canberra woman Irma Palasics.

title.children: Man denied bail as details emerge of undercover cop following suspect to help solve violent home invasion cold case

image.altText: A graphic of a street with streetlights changing their intensity. Stars in the sky become more visible as the lights are dimmed.

props.synopsis: An "adaptive lighting" project in Canberra, which reduced the brightness of streetlights by up to half, showed a 25 per cent reduction in light pollution.

title.children: Turning down streetlights at night shown to reduce light pollution and carbon emissions

image.altText: Machinery digs up the tram tracks along Glenelg's Jetty Road.

props.synopsis: The potentially politically explosive overhaul is the first major shift in commonwealth-state land transport infrastructure funding arrangements since 2019.

title.children: States and territories to pay more for major infrastructure projects under secretive new deal

image.altText: Maroon woollen boy's cap. The words CHAMPAGNAT and DIEU ME VOIT are on the badge.

props.synopsis: A new lawsuit reveals a "psychopathic" paedophile teacher was employed in a Marist Brothers school despite a prior conviction for child sexual abuse and having previously been banished from the Victorian Education Department school system.

title.children: Marist Brothers face legal action over alleged abuse by 'psychopathic' paedophile

image.altText: Sumaya Abu Ghaliba sits on a hospital bed with daylight coming in a window behind her.

props.synopsis: Children like Sumaya are among the thousands estimated to have lost a limb in the nine months of the Gaza war, and doctors say the situation inside some hospitals is so bad they're sometimes amputating without anaesthesia.

title.children: When morphine ran out in Gaza, doctors say amputations became a 'never-ending nightmare'

image.altText: Robert F Kennedy Jr holds a microphone during a speech.

props.synopsis: Robert F Kennedy Jr, who was running for the US presidential election as an independent, says he no longer believes he has a "realistic path to victory".

title.children: Robert F Kennedy Jr suspends US presidential campaign and backs Trump

image.altText: A crowd of onlookers - mostly couples in their 30s - wearing puffer jackets and holding umbrellas along a residential street.

props.synopsis: Many hopeful homebuyers turn up at property auctions every weekend just to see the price soar beyond their expectations and out of their reach. But is it underquoting?

title.children: 'Thousands duped every weekend':  'Widespread' problem bringing homebuyers to tears

image.altText: A warlord with a massive beard drives an modern-looking car

props.synopsis: Ramzan Kadyrov's relationship with Vladimir Putin means he can run Chechnya as his own personal fiefdom and launch strange publicity stunts like mounting a machine gun to a Tesla Cybertruck.

title.children: The 'Kremlin dragon', a Tesla truck and an offended Elon Musk: Putin's bad week takes an odd turn

image.altText: A bald man wearing glasses and a suit gestures passionately.

props.synopsis: Politics is a rough business and not for the faint-hearted but politicians railing about people being vilified should look twice at the way they treat those in wildly unequal positions of power.

title.children: It's brutal, it's bullying and it's not covered by parliament's new conduct rules

image.altText: A woman in bikini holding shots smiling to camera.

props.synopsis: An Indonesian citizen who often went by the name Putry Thornhill has been sentenced to an 18-month community correction order over counterfeit luxury designer handbags. But other alleged victims say justice hasn't been done.

title.children: Lian met a woman on an app, on the second date he knew she 'had to be' a con artist

image.altText: A woman points in front of a crowd

props.synopsis: After weeks of turmoil and President Joe Biden's historic decision to step aside, Kamala Harris has made her pitch to the American people to vote for her over Donald Trump. Here's what you missed.

title.children: With just weeks to prepare, Kamala Harris gives the biggest speech of her life. These were the key moments

image.altText: A composite image of Linda Reynolds and Brittany Higgins.

props.synopsis: The witnesses have wrapped up their evidence and the legal teams are preparing their final pitches to the judge as the mammoth defamation trial between WA Senator Linda Reynolds and her ex-staffer Brittany Higgins nears its end. Here's what we've learned.

title.children: Seven key takeaways from Linda Reynolds's blockbuster defamation case against Brittany Higgins

image.altText: A man in a business shirt and suit jacket sits in a chair in an office, looking serious as he's interviewed for television.

props.synopsis: The Minister for Fair Trading, Anoulack Chanthivong, orders an urgent review of the NSW Strata and Property Services Commissioner's $780,000 stake in a major real estate group.

title.children: Strata commissioner's $780,000 stake in property group in the spotlight

image.altText: A hooded man holds a laptop computer as blue screen with an exclamation mark is projected on him

props.synopsis: The intelligence community is warning of an increase in US election interference as voting day approaches. But each set of hackers have their own methods and motives.

title.children: Iranian, Russian and Chinese hackers are targeting the upcoming US election at an ever increasing pace

image.altText: Emergency services workers on a rescue boat in the sea

props.synopsis: Mike Lynch's daughter, Hannah, was the last person accounted for after the superyacht capsized and sank on Monday.

title.children: Body of Mike Lynch's daughter found after superyacht sinking, sources say

image.altText: Emergency services workers stand on verge of river as crashed bus is seen submerged

props.synopsis: There were 43 people on board the bus and all of them were Indian nationals, according to the Indian Embassy in Kathmandu.

title.children: Nepal crash kills 27 people and injures 16 after bus plunges into river

image.altText: F1 reserve driver Jack Doohan during the launch of the Alpine F1 car, wearing a racing suit with no helmet

props.synopsis: Australian racing driver Jack Doohan will compete in Formula 1 next season after being announced as Alpine's newest driver.

title.children: 'Dream come true': Doohan legacy continues as Jack confirmed as Alpine's newest F1 driver

image.altText: GettyImages-1338374678

props.synopsis: As one of Australia's most-recognisable Paralympians, Madison de Rozario's voice holds significant strength heading into Paris — and she believes old tropes need to change.

title.children: 'We're so comfortable with that narrative': De Rozario tackles old tropes of Paralympic inspiration

image.altText: Hockeyroos player Georgie Parker dribbling during a game.

props.synopsis: As the afterglow from the Paris Olympics fades, many athletes are grappling with the realities of returning to business as usual. Former Hockeyroo Georgie Parker says this can be harder than it appears.

title.children: Why this former Hockeyroo is removing her Olympic rings tattoo

image.altText: Craig McRae during 2024 Magpies-Demons AFL match at the MCG.

props.synopsis: Collingwood's 46-point win over Melbourne at the MCG is not enough to see the Magpies sneak into the finals, as the 2023 premiers start looking to next season.

title.children: 'Lots of lessons learned': McRae reflects as Magpies' premiership defence ends short of finals

image.altText: Adam Reynolds of the Broncos kicks the ball

props.synopsis: Brisbane have come from 16 points down to defeat the Parramatta Eels 30-24 to keep their hopes of finals alive.

title.children: Reynolds masterclass leads Brisbane to comeback win to keep season alive

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with Micaela Cronin.

props.synopsis: An expert panel examining how to best prevent violence against women and children has called on alcohol, gambling and porn companies to be more proactive in tackling the crisis.

title.children: Family violence review calls for total gambling ad ban and tougher alcohol sale laws

image.altText: A man sits in the steps of a bus

props.synopsis: Danny Reinhold couldn't afford to rent a permanent home. His fight to live in a bus has led to a rule change for temporary homes that will help others at risk of rough sleeping.

title.children: WA pensioner took on law and won right to live in his bus, sparking statewide rule change

image.altText: A multi storey building construction site situated on a street corner block with branded red text across the fence

props.synopsis: Nicheliving is granted a stay order by WA's State Administrative Tribunal to allow it to keep building, as more than 200 homes remain unfinished by the company.

title.children: Nicheliving given permission to keep operating, after tribunal rules in embattled company's favour

image.altText: An older man with a serious expression and a 'water is life' shirt looks at the camera. More people are behind him.

props.synopsis: A group of native title holders from Central Australia have launched a fresh appeal against one of the largest groundwater licenses granted in Northern Territory history.

title.children: Native title holders launch fresh appeal over Singleton Station groundwater licence

image.altText: Two people stand and smile holding award.

props.synopsis: A heroic boy from Hughenden in Queensland's north-west is presented with a bravery award for staying calm and collected during an emergency call to get help for his mum.

title.children: Twelve-year-old boy recognised for bravery and 'amazing' calm after mum hit by fireball from faulty mower

image.altText: A closeup of Dinush's face.

props.synopsis: Accused murderer Dinush Kurera has told a court he could not remember how many times he swung an axe at his wife Nelomie Perera, blaming his memory loss on the fear he was experiencing.

title.children: Man claims he suffered memory loss while allegedly murdering wife with axe

image.altText: A reflective moment

props.synopsis: A polo captain and ferry operator TT-Line were charged after 16 polo ponies died during a voyage on the Spirit of Tasmania. The “most serious charge” has been dismissed — with the company now facing a significantly lower fine than before.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania operator fined $250 per horse, six years after polo pony deaths

image.altText: Three women and three men pose for a photo around a TV studio desk.

props.synopsis: After five years, thousands of coffees, and more early-morning alarms than you could poke a stick at, Lisa Millar is farewelling News Breakfast.

title.children: Lisa Millar's reflections on switching off the News Breakfast alarm one last time
